{"step_by_step_thinking": "Occlusion, in a dental context, refers to the contact between teeth. More technically, it is the relationship between the maxillary (upper) and mandibular (lower) teeth when they approach each other, as occurs during chewing or at rest. This contact is not just at a single point or edge, but involves the entire surface of the teeth that are designed to meet, which includes the cusps and grooves of the teeth.", "answer_choice": "D. Surface-to-surface contact"}
